properties.areaDesc: Lake Superior from Saxon Harbor WI to Upper Entrance to Portage Canal MI 5NM off shore to the US/Canadian border including Isle Royal National Park
properties.headline: Heavy Freezing Spray Watch issued January 20 at 4:52AM EST until January 21 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Marquette MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 30 kt with gusts up to 35 kt and
waves 6 to 11 feet possible. Heavy freezing spray at a rate of
2 cm per hour or greater possible, and may rapidly accumulate
on vessels.

* WHERE...Lake Superior from Saxon Harbor WI to Upper Entrance
to Portage Canal MI 5NM off shore to the US/Canadian border
including Isle Royale National Park.

* WHEN...For the Gale Watch, from late tonight through Tuesday
afternoon. For the Heavy Freezing Spray Watch, from this
evening through Tuesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Operating a vessel in heavy freezing spray is
hazardous. Freezing spray may render mechanical and electronic
components inoperative. Ice accretion on decks and
superstructures may result in a catastrophic loss of stability.
Strong winds can cause hazardous waves which could capsize or
damage vessels and reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid or mitigate
hazardous accumulation of ice on their vessel.

Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid possible
hazardous conditions.  Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter
course, and/or secure the vessel for severe wind and waves.

NWSheadline: HEAVY FREEZING SPRAY WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...GALE WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON
